text:
Katy Perry, MTV VMA host and Taylor Swift’s frenemy who doesn’t really want to be her frenemy anymore, did indeed miss the premiere of Swift’s "Look What You Made Me Do" video premiere—and its Perry shade—during the show.

Perry wasn’t visible on stage or in the audience before or after the video played during the broadcast. E! reports that was because she was backstage, changing into one of her 10 outfits for the night.

She was very aware of what was happening though. "Everyone backstage was going insane over it, and a few people gave her the highlights," a source told the outlet. "Knowing Katy, I'm sure she has seen it by now."

The source emphasized that Perry really, really, really doesn’t want to be part of the Taylor Swift feud narrative anymore. "Katy wants the Taylor war to be in the past and she is focused on moving forward," the source said.

But Swift is the one thing stopping that from happening. "Katy wants to be cool with Taylor, but [Taylor] isn't budging," the source said. "Katy is focusing on herself and her upcoming tour right now and doesn't want any bad energy."

Perry also wasn’t bothered that—despite rumors up until the beginning of the ceremony that Swift may make an appearance (she’s "ready to come out of hiding," a source told People in an article posted shortly before the show started)—Swift didn’t come or make peace with Perry on stage. "Katy knew well beforehand that Taylor wasn't going to show, and it didn't faze her," the source explained.

"She was in a good mood and really didn't care if Taylor was going to show up or not. This was her time to shine and really make an appearance for herself. She didn't want to let anyone down, so she kept a positive attitude."
authors: Where She Oversees Coverage Of Celebrities
title: Katy Perry Really Did Avoid Watching Taylor Swift’s "Look What You Made Me Do" at the VMAs
